description:
NGC 281- HYBRID BICOLOR
NGC 281, better known as the Pacman Nebula, is an interstellar cloud of ionized gas (emission nebula) located in the constellation of Cassiopeia. The nebula appears curiously furrowed by a dark region that crosses the object and also determines its shape.
This photograph was obtained with only signals in Ha (red ionized hydrogen) and in O-III (ionized oxygen) by combining the two mochromatic channels and obtaining a single photo in false colors. This false color image, obtained through appropriate post production processes, is also called two-color and is suitable for highlighting the distribution of gas.
It is a pity that the weather conditions did not allow us to collect further signals.

HA (Emanuele La Barbera)
-Skywatcher 130/650 pds
-Skywatcher Heq-5 Rowan belt mod
-ZWO ASI 183 mm pro
-ZWO Asiair pro
-Autoguide Omegon 80/400+ ZWO ASI 120 mc
-EFW 8x 1.25" with Astronomik H-alpha 6nm CCD
-Coma corrector Baader MPCC
-40x600s gain 120, temp -15°C +11x600s gain 200, temp -15°C, bin 2x2

O-III (Alessio Pariani)
-Sharpstar 100q
-Ioptron CEM25P
-Astrel Instrument AST8300X
-Autoguide TS Optics 50mm guide scope+ZWO ASI 120 mm
-4x1800" , temp -10C, bin 1x1 + Astrodon O-III 3nm
-USB_Focus v3 Robotic focuser

Location: Palermo and Busto Arsizio - Bortle Class 8
Software: Pixinsight, Adobe Photoshop
title: NGC 281 - HYBRID BICOLOR PALETTE
